text: Rete testis is a network of small tubules found in the part of the testicle that carries sperm. They can sometimes get cysts. == Purpose == The rete testis have concentrated sperm and fluid in them, and they help the epididymis to absorb this fluid. If the fluid is not absorbed, the person can be infertile. == Gallery== Image:Gray1149.png|The tubes in the testis == Other pages == * Testes == Other websites == * Image at UC Davis * Diagram * Diagram category:Anatomy of the male reproductive system
title: Rete testis
